    "content": "# Work Summary: Comprehensive Person Structure & Empty Folder Population

**Date:** February 10, 2026
**Tasks:** (1) Design complete 1.0.* structure, (2) Populate all empty folders

---

## ✅ Task 1: Comprehensive Person Structure - COMPLETE

### File Created
**`1 - People/1.0 People definitions/1.0.0-COMPREHENSIVE-PERSON-STRUCTURE.md`**
- **Size:** ~25,000 words
- **Status:** Complete and comprehensive

### What's Included

Defined **EVERYTHING** a person might want to store in their Hypernet account:

#### Major Categories (1.X.0 - 1.X.15)

**1.X.0 - Profile & Identity**
- Basic profile, biography, professional identity
- Education, skills, public presence
- Government IDs and documents
- Physical characteristics

**1.X.1 - Projects & Work**
- Active, completed, archived projects
- Work history, business ventures
- Intellectual property

**1.X.2 - Documents & Files**
- Personal, business, legal documents
- Financial, insurance, property documents
- Medical, education, reference materials
- Vehicle documents

**1.X.3 - Communications**
- Email (all accounts, archives)
- Messages & chat (SMS, WhatsApp, Signal, Telegram, etc.)
- Voice & video calls
- Social media messages
- Letters & correspondence
- Meeting notes

**1.X.4 - Relationships & Social**
- Family, friends, professional network
- Romantic relationships, social connections
- Contacts database
- Events & gatherings

**1.X.5 - Tasks & Productivity**
- Active tasks, completed tasks
- Projects & goals
- Calendar & schedule
- Habits & routines
- Time tracking, workflows

**1.X.6 - Personal Data (Hypernet Objects)**
Structured data across 20 subcategories:
- 1.X.6.1 - Media Objects (photos, videos, audio)
- 1.X.6.2 - Social Media
- 1.X.6.3 - Email & Messages
- 1.X.6.4 - Web Browsing
- 1.X.6.5 - Documents
- 1.X.6.6 - Locations
- 1.X.6.7 - Financial Data
- 1.X.6.8 - Health & Fitness
- 1.X.6.9 - Calendar Events
- 1.X.6.10 - Tasks
- 1.X.6.11 - Contacts
- 1.X.6.12 - Notes
- 1.X.6.13 - Shopping & Purchases
- 1.X.6.14 - Travel
- 1.X.6.15 - Education & Learning
- 1.X.6.16 - Entertainment
- 1.X.6.17 - Food & Cooking
- 1.X.6.18 - Home & Property
- 1.X.6.19 - Vehicles

**1.X.7 - Contributions & Output**
- Code contributions
- Writing & publications
- Creative work, teaching
- Community contributions
- Inventions, professional deliverables

**1.X.8 - Media & Creative**
- Photos (personal, family, events, travel)
- Videos (home videos, events, projects)
- Audio (voice memos, recordings, interviews)
- Music library
- Artistic work, video projects
- Podcasts & audio projects

**1.X.9 - Notes & Knowledge**
- Personal notes, journal entries
- Research & reference
- Learning materials
- Knowledge base, meeting notes
- Project notes, book summaries
- Ideas & creativity
- Personal wiki

**Extended Categories:**

**1.X.10 - Passwords & Credentials** 🔐
- Website logins, app passwords
- WiFi passwords, credit card PINs
- SSH keys, API keys
- 2FA backup codes
- Security questions

**1.X.11 - Financial Management** 💰
- Net worth tracking, budgets
- Income, expenses, investments
- Retirement planning, tax planning
- Debt tracking, savings goals
- Bills, credit score

**1.X.12 - Medical & Health** 🏥
- Complete medical history
- Current medications, allergies
- Immunization records, family history
- Lab results, imaging
- Health goals, symptom tracking
- Mental health records

**1.X.13 - Legal & Estate** ⚖️
- Will and testament, trust documents
- Power of attorney, living will
- Beneficiary designations
- Digital asset instructions
- Funeral wishes

**1.X.14 - Hobbies & Interests** 🎨
- Hobby projects, collections
- Sports, gaming, crafts
- DIY projects, gardening
- Pet records

**1.X.15 - Genealogy & Family History** 🌳
- Family tree (complete)
- Ancestor information
- DNA test results
- Family stories, historical documents
- Family heirlooms

---

## Additional Specifications Included

### Privacy & Security Settings
- Per-category privacy controls (Private, Family, Friends, Professional, Public, AI Access, Legacy)
- Two-factor authentication
- End-to-end encryption for sensitive data
- Granular permissions per AI company
- Data retention and export

### Data Formats & Integration
**Supported formats:**
- Documents: PDF, DOCX, TXT, Markdown, Excel, CSV
- Media: JPEG, PNG, GIF, HEIC, RAW, MP4, MOV, MP3, WAV
- Specialized: .mbox, .pst, .ics, vCard

**Integration sources:**
- Communication: Gmail, Outlook, WhatsApp, Signal, Slack
- Cloud Storage: Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive, iCloud
- Social Media: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok
- Financial: Mint, Plaid, cryptocurrency exchanges
- Health: Apple Health, Fitbit, Garmin, MyFitnessPal
- Productivity: Notion, Evernote, Todoist, Asana, Google Calendar
- Entertainment: Spotify, Netflix, Goodreads, Kindle, Steam

### Implementation Priority
- **Phase 1 (MVP):** Profile, Media, Documents, Email, Contacts
- **Phase 2:** Financial, Health, Tasks, Notes
- **Phase 3:** Passwords, Shopping, Travel, Entertainment, Hobbies, Genealogy

### Usage Examples
Included 3 detailed examples:
1. Family photo with complete metadata and links
2. Medical appointment record with privacy settings
3. Financial transaction with event linking

---

## ✅ Task 2: Empty Folder Population - IN PROGRESS

### Approach
Launched **3 parallel agents** to populate 100+ empty folders:

**Agent 1:** Matt's person folders (1.1)
- Projects (Active, Completed, Archived)
- Documents (Personal, Business, Legal, Reference)
- Communications (Email, Meeting Notes, Correspondence)
- Relationships (Professional, Personal, Organizational)
- Tasks (Active, Completed, Recurring)
- Personal Data (Hypernet Data, Privacy, Permissions)
- Contributions (Code, Documentation, Design, Other)
- Media (Photos, Videos, Audio)
- Notes (Personal, Research, Learning)

**Agent 2:** Family member folders (1.2-1.7)
- Sarah, John, Bridget, Mark, Richard, Ollie
- All same subfolder structure as Matt
- Template/placeholder content for each

**Agent 3:** Core infrastructure folders
- Research documentation folder
- Security framework folder
- Services folder (business logic)
- Tests folder
- Legacy "0/" structure folders

### Expected Output
Each README will include:
1. Purpose of that specific folder
2. What types of data go there
3. Examples of what might be stored
4. Privacy considerations
5. Integration sources (where applicable)

### Benefit
All folders will show in GitHub (no empty folders hidden)

---

## Key Achievements

### Comprehensiveness
The 1.0.0 structure covers literally **everything**:
- ✅ Email messages
- ✅ Photos, videos, audio
- ✅ Passwords & credentials
- ✅ Medical information (complete)
- ✅ Financial information (complete)
- ✅ Documents (all types)
- ✅ Social media data
- ✅ Shopping & purchases
- ✅ Travel records
- ✅ Entertainment tracking
- ✅ Food & recipes
- ✅ Home inventory
- ✅ Vehicle records
- ✅ Legal & estate planning
- ✅ Hobbies & interests
- ✅ Genealogy & family history
- ✅ And much more...

### Organization
Data is logically organized into:
- **9 major categories** (0-9)
- **15+ total categories** (including extended)
- **100+ subcategories**
- **Clear hierarchy** and addressing

### Integration-Ready
Defined import paths for:
- 30+ major services and platforms
- All common file formats
- Email archives (Gmail, Outlook, etc.)
- Cloud storage (Drive, Dropbox, iCloud)
- Social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.)
- Financial services (Mint, Plaid)
- Health apps (Apple Health, Fitbit, etc.)
- Productivity tools (Notion, Evernote, etc.)

### Privacy-First
- Granular privacy controls per category
- Never-share categories (passwords, medical)
- Optional AI access per category
- Legacy/posthumous settings
- Full user control

---

## Technical Details

### Hypernet Addressing
```
1.X.Y.Z.NNNNN
│ │ │ │ └─ Instance number (00001-99999)
│ │ │ └─ Sub-category
│ │ └─ Category (0-15+)
│ └─ Person ID
└─ Living People

Example: 1.1.6.1.00142 = Matt's Photo #142
```

### Object Type Mapping
Each category maps to universal object types defined in 0.5:
- Photos → 0.5.2.1
- Email → 0.5.3.1
- Transactions → 0.5.6.2
- Health Records → 0.5.6.4
- etc.

### Database Schema
Structured data stored as Hypernet objects with:
- Properties (metadata)
- Links (relationships to other objects)
- Privacy settings
- AI access permissions
- Audit trails

---

## What This Enables

### For Users
- **Complete life storage:** Everything in one place
- **Privacy control:** Granular permissions
- **AI superpowers:** Contextual AI with full life context
- **Data portability:** Easy import/export
- **Legacy planning:** Choose what becomes public

### For AI Companies
- **Rich context:** Access to user's complete life (with permission)
- **Better products:** Build AI that truly understands users
- **Fair compensation:** Users get paid for data access
- **Trust:** Transparent, user-controlled access

### For Developers
- **Clear structure:** Know exactly where data goes
- **Standard format:** Consistent across all users
- **Easy integration:** Well-
